body_html:
@goodfeli, could I ask you to take a look at this one, since you wrote _hessian_vector_product a while ago? I'm not sure what the difference between this and calling _hessian_vector_product with v = 1 is (other than the kwargs, which we'd be fine adding). As is, I'm worried about adding new, restricted functionality without a good reason, since this is just a composition of two functions that any user can write themselves. (In contrast, _hessian_vector_product does a bit more subtle work with stop_gradient to make things efficient).

(I also don't fully understand why you say the hessian can only be computed for 1-D vectors, but I admit I don't understand the details).
